alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Dallam; Deaf Smith; Hansford; Hartley; Hutchinson; Moore; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall; Sherman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 30 at 4:17AM CDT until March 31 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 1 AM CDT FRIDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN AND CENTRAL PANHANDLES... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 10 PM CDT FRIDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN AND CENTRAL PANHANDLES... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 9 AM to 10 PM CDT Friday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron and Texas. In Texas... Dallam...Sherman...Hansford...Hartley...Moore...Hutchinson... Oldham...Potter...Carson...Deaf Smith...Randall...Armstrong and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...For today, Southwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. For Friday, West 30 to 40 mph mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * Relative Humidity...For today, as low as 8 percent. For Friday, as low as 5 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...For today, 7 to 8 in the west with 4 to 6 in the central Panhandles. For Friday, 6 to 8 with the higher threat to the south. * Timing...Noon today through 1 AM Friday. Again, from 9 AM Friday morning through 10 PM Friday evening.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
